article.headline: Saunders scores 20, McNeese defeats Incarnate Word 80-66

images.name: McNeese's Christian Shumate goes baseline for the dunk
images.caption: McNeese's Christian Shumate hauls in the pass on the baseline and goes up for the two-handed jam.

article.linkText: Saunders scores 20, McNeese defeats Incarnate Word 80-66
article.story: SAN ANTONIO -- — Mike Saunders Jr.'s 20 points helped McNeese defeat Incarnate Word 80-66 on Saturday night. Saunders was 6-of-10 shooting, including 2 for 5 from 3-point range, and went 6 for 7 from the foul line for the Cowboys (16-2, 5-0 Southland Conference). Christian Shumate added 13 points while going 6 of 9 from the field, and he also had seven rebounds and three steals. CJ Felder was 4-of-5 shooting and 3 of 4 from the free-throw line to finish with 11 points. The Cowboys picked up their 11th straight win. The Cardinals (5-12, 0-4) were led in scoring by Dylan Hayman, who finished with 10 points and six rebounds. Sky Wicks added 10 points for Incarnate Word. Elijah Davis also had nine points and six rebounds. ------ The Associated Press created this story using technology provided by Data Skrive and data from Sportradar.

statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
